intro: Oroya peruviana var. depressa, commonly known as the Andean morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Oroya peruviana var. depressa is valued for its ornamental beauty and has cultural significance in some Andean communities.
